div1.p: Special Orders #64 assigns Gorgas and Echeverria to a medical board to decide about disposing medical property used for yellow fever patients. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for William Crawford Gorgas and Rafael T. Echeverria, July 20, 1900
div1.p:
Adjutant General's
OFFICE.
AUG 8 1900
ROLLS DIVISION.
[unclear]

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVE
Vol 179 B 1900

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
AND PINAR DEL RIO.

1. Private Marquis D. Harrod, Troop L, 7th Cavalry, is
hereby detailed on special duty as messenger at these head-
quarters, vice Private Jessie Thurston, Troop B, 7th Cavalry,
discharged (expiration of service).

Under the provisions of A. R. 1272, the Subsistence De-
partment will commute the rations of Private Harrod,
whilst he is engaged on this duty, at the rate of seventy-
five (75) cents per day, it being impracticable to provide
for his subsistence in any other way.

2. General Prisoners Frank A. Newman, late private Bat-
tery G, 2d Artillery; Edward Murphy, late private Battery
O, 2d Artillery; William Pentland, late private Battery K,
2d Artillery; and Charles R. Reed, late private Battery N,
2d Artillery; whose sentences will expire as follows: New-
man, August 3, 1900; Murphy, August 7, 1900; Pentland,
August 10, 1900; and Reed, August 24, 1900; will be fur-
nished transportation and subsistence to the United States
on a United States transport.

The Commanding Officer, Cabaña Barracks, will ascer-
tain the probable date of departure of a transport after the
expiration of their sentences, and in the meantime retain
these men in his command.

3. Pursuant to instructions contained in an endorse-
ment, dated Headquarters Division of Cuba, July 19, 1900,
a board of survey, to consist of:
Major W. C. Gorgas, Surgeon, U. S. Army;
Major R. F. Echeverria, Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers;

Acting Assistant Surgeon George R. Plummer, U. S.
Army;

will convene at Las Animas Hospital, Havana, at 10
o'clock A. M., Monday, the 23d instant, or as soon there-
after as practicable, for the purpose of reporting upon and
recommending the disposal that should be made of a lot of
medical property at that Hospital which has been used for
yellow fever patients, and for which Major Orlando Ducker,
Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers, is reported responsible.
BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL LEE:

R. E. L. MICHIE,
Assistant Adjutant General.
